text: Elwood Hughes Edwards Jr. (November 6, 1949 - November 5, 2024) was an American voice actor and radio host. He was best known as the voice of the Internet service provider America Online. He first recorded several lines for the provider in 1989. His lines include: "Welcome", "You've got mail", "You've got pictures", "You've got voicemail", "File's done", and "Goodbye", all recorded in his own living room on a cassette deck. Edwards was born in Glen Burnie, Maryland. He was raised in Beaufort, North Carolina. In his later years, he worked as an Uber driver. Edwards died on November 5, 2024 in New Bern, North Carolina from problems caused by a stroke, one day before his 75th birthday. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1949 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American voice actors Category:Actors from Maryland Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Actors from North Carolina Category:Internet celebrities Category:American radio personalities
title: Elwood Edwards
